newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Florida Panthers rise 15 pct.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Florida Panthers rise 15 pct.

text.p: Shares of the Florida Panthers rose 15 percent at their market debut as investors snapped up shares of the National Hockey League team.
Shares rose 1-1/2 to 11-1/2. About 2.7 million shares were offered for $10 each.

Although the company had a weak financial record, analysts expected the deal to shine due to its smashing team record and the Midas touch of owner Wayne Huizenga. He built video chain Blockbuster Entertainment, controls Republic Industries Inc, and owns the Miami Dolphins football team and the Florida Marlins baseball team.
The following stocks also made their market debuts today:
-- Smallworldwide Plc shares were flat at $11 after their IPO of 2.8 million American Depositary Receipts representing the same amount of ordinary shares.

The Cambridge, England company is a vendor of software for the spatial design, engineering and management of complex physical networks. They can be used by telecommunications companies and utilities to plan, design and build infrastructures.
-- American Medserve Corp shares jumped 2-1/4 to 17-1/4. The Napersville, Illinois company offered 5,357,000 shares for $15 each. William Blair was the lead underwriter.

Analysts had said they expected the company to have a strong debut. American Medserve is a provider of pharmacy services to long-term care institutions, including skilled nursing facilities, assisted living facilities and other long-term health care settings.

-- Steiner Leisure Ltd shares rose 3/8 to 13-3/8 after its IPO of 4.4 million shares, which priced a notch below its $14 to $16 estimated pricing range. The lead underwriter was Raymond James. The company, based in the Bahamas, provides beauty, massage and fitness services on cruise ships.
-- O'Gara Corp shares inched up 1/8 to 9-1/8. The Fairfield, Ohio company makes ballistic and blast protected vehicle armoring systems. It offered 2.0 million shares, down from its initial estimates.
-- Decor Group shares rose 8 to 18. The Mount Vernon, New York company offered 325,000 shares for $10 each.
-- Ocurest Laboratories Inc units rose 1/8 to 4-1/8 from their IPO price of $4.
-- Hertz Technology shares rose to $9 each from their IPO price of $5.50 a share. Biltmore Securities was the lead underwriter of the offering.
-- Shares of NAM Corp rose 2 to 6 from their IPO price of 4.
